summarize_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices
summarize_audit.output:
Key Points:
- Project: Launch digital loan application and approval system for personal loans at XYZ Bank to replace current outdated manual process.
- Online application to include Aadhaar/PAN-based prefill, integration with CIBIL for credit scores, AI-based eligibility and risk assessment, real-time KYC document verification, and loan sanction and e-agreement via OTP-based authentication.
- Business goals: Decrease turnaround time from 5 days to 2 hours, decrease manual data entry by 80%, and increase eligibility check accuracy to 90%.
- Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules and Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions are out of scope.
- Stakeholders include Product Manager Rahul Sharma, Business Head – Retail Lending Priya Iyer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha, and Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta.
- Key features: Responsive web app, Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and verification, credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL, eligibility rules, risk scoring using an internal AI model, e-sign integration, and dashboard.
- Assumptions: Customers will have Aadhaar-linked mobile numbers, the system will support English and Hindi, and loan disbursement will only happen through verified bank accounts.

Actions:
- Finalize requirements by 15 March 2025.
- Begin development on 1 April 2025.
- Conduct user acceptance testing on 1 June 2025.
- Plan for system go-live on 1 July 2025.

Blockers:
- Potential delay in gaining API access to the credit bureau.
- Resistance from customers uncomfortable with digital onboarding.
- Possible compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines.
summarize_audit.audit_summary:
- Summary of Action: The 'summarize' agent has outlined the key points and actions related to the launch of a digital loan application and approval system for personal loans at XYZ Bank. The summary includes project scope, business goals, stakeholders, key features, assumptions, and timeline for implementation. It also identifies potential blockers such as API access delays, customer resistance, and compliance changes.
  
- User Involved: The stakeholders mentioned are Product Manager Rahul Sharma, Business Head – Retail Lending Priya Iyer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha, and Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta.

- Risk Flags: Medium. The risks associated with API access delays, customer resistance to digital onboarding, and compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines could impact the project's timeline and success.

- Recommendations (if any):
  1. Ensure transparency in communication with stakeholders regarding potential risks and blockers.
  2. Implement robust data handling and access control measures to protect customer information, especially concerning Aadhaar and PAN data.
  3. Develop contingency plans to address potential delays in API access and customer resistance.
  4. Stay updated on RBI guidelines and ensure compliance to avoid regulatory issues.
  5. Conduct thorough testing and validation of AI-based eligibility and risk assessment modules to ensure accuracy and reliability.

- Timestamp: The timeline for the project is set with requirements finalization by 15 March 2025, development kickoff on 1 April 2025, UAT on 1 June 2025, and go-live on 1 July 2025.

summarize_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks

 Business Objectives

 Non-functional Requirements

 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices
summarize_audit.output:
Key Points: 
1. The proposed project's aim is digitalizing the loan application process at XYZ Bank to improve customer experience and efficiency.
2. The process will incorporate Aadhaar/PAN-based pre-fill forms, credit score fetching, AI-based eligibility assessments, real-time document verification, and digital sanctioning of loans.
3. Key stakeholder roles are identified, including Rahul Sharma as Product Manager, Priya Iyer as Business Head – Retail Lending, Rakesh Sinha as IT Manager, and Anjali Mehta as Compliance Lead.
4. The system is planned to support English and Hindi and requires an Aadhaar-linked mobile number from the user.
5. It is noted that this system is not extended to home, car, and business loans.
6. Project Timeline includes Requirements Finalization by March 15, 2025, Development Kickoff by April 1, 2025, UAT by June 1, 2025 and Go-Live by July 1, 2025.
7. Success Metrics: Reduce turnaround time from 5 days to 2 hours, an 80% reduction in manual data entry, and 90% accuracy in eligibility checks.

1. Delay in API access to credit bureau might affect the project timeline.

3. Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines pose potential risks to project execution.

summarize_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices
summarize_audit.output:
Key Points:
1. The objective is to digitize the loan origination process for personal loans at XYZ Bank.
2. An online platform has been proposed that allows customers to apply, get eligibility assessment, upload KYC documents, track the application status, and receive approval digitally for personal loans.
3. Key stakeholders include Product Manager Rahul Sharma, Business Head – Retail Lending Priya Iyer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha, and Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta.
4. A few in-scope elements are online loan application forms with Aadhaar/PAN-based prefill, credit scores from CIBIL, AI-based risk assessment module, real-time document verification, OTP-based agreement signing, and integration with core banking for disbursement.
5. API integration with Credit Bureau might get delayed, resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding, and changes in compliance due to RBI guidelines are the main risks.

Actions:
1. Finalize requirements by 15th March 2025.
2. Start development on 1st April 2025.
3. Schedule User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for 1st June 2025.
4. Plan to go live on 1st July 2025.

Blockers:
1. Delay in API access to Credit Bureau could hinder progress.
2. Resistance from customers uncomfortable with digital onboarding will need to be addressed to ensure customer adaption.
3. Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines may require system adjustments.

Key Points:
- The objective is to digitize the loan origination process for personal loans at XYZ Bank to improve customer experience and reduce turnaround time & errors.
- This involves building an online platform for loan applications, KYC document upload, eligibility assessment, application status tracking and digital approvals. 
- Features include an online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN prefill, integration with CIBIL for credit scores, AI-based eligibility and risk assessment, real-time KYC document verification, loan sanction via OTP authentication, and integration with core banking for disbursement.

- Resistance from customers who are not comfortable with digital onboarding process.
- Compliance changes due to the upcoming guidelines from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI).

Success Metrics:
- Reduce Turn Around Time (TAT) from 5 days to 2 hours.
- Achieve 80% reduction in manual data entry.
- Ensure 90% accuracy in eligibility checks.
